required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Allergen BioCube (ABC) Study Evaluating the Efficacy of Fluticasone Propionate Nasal Spray Compared to Placebo
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Center, Randomized, Double-Masked, Placebo-Controlled Evaluation of the Efficacy of Flonase (Fluticasone Propionate Nasal Spray) Compared to Placebo Nasal Spray in the Allergen BioCube (ABC) Model

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the onset of action of fluticasone propionate nasal spray compared to placebo nasal spray in reducing nasal allergic signs and symptoms following ragweed exposure in the Allergen BioCube (ABC) after up to 14 days of at home dosing.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Total Nasal Signs and Symptoms Score From Baseline (Day 0) to Visit 5 (Day 16)
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-ABC exposure and approximately every 15 minutes, up to 180 minutes, while in the ABC on Day 0 and Day 16
primary_outcome.description: The change in the total sum of the four symptoms (total nasal symptom scores - TNSS) ranging from 0 to 16 with higher score indicating a more severe reaction. The change in the TNSS score between Day 0 and Day 16 was analyzed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Baseline Nasal Itching Score on Day 0 to Average Nasal Itching Score on Day 16
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-ABC exposure and approximately every 15 minutes, up to 180 minutes, while in the ABC on Day 0 and Day 16
secondary_outcome.description: Nasal Itching was assessed by the participants pre-ABC exposure and approximately every 15 minutes while in the ABC on Day 0 and Day 16 on a 0-4 scale (0 = none to 4 = severe). The change in average nasal itching score between Day 0 and Day 16 was analyzed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Baseline Sneezing Score on Day 0 to Average Sneezing Score on Day 16
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-ABC exposure and approximately every 15 minutes, up to 180 minutes, while in the ABC on Day 0 and Day 16
secondary_outcome.description: Sneezing was assessed by the participants pre-ABC exposure and approximately every 15 minutes while in the ABC on Day 0 and Day 16 on a 0-4 scale (0 = none to 4 = severe). The change in average sneezing score between Day 0 and Day 16 was analyzed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Baseline Rhinorrhea Score on Day 0 to Average Rhinorrhea Score on Day 16
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-ABC exposure and approximately every 15 minutes, up to 180 minutes, while in the ABC on Day 0 and Day 16
secondary_outcome.description: Rhinorrhea was assessed by the participants pre-ABC exposure and approximately every 15 minutes while in the ABC on Day 0 and Day 16 on a 0-4 scale (0 = none to 4 = severe). The change in average rhinorrhea score between Day 0 and Day 16 was analyzed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Baseline Nasal Congestion Score on Day 0 to Average Nasal Congestion Score on Day 16
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-ABC exposure and approximately every 15 minutes, up to 180 minutes, while in the ABC on Day 0 and Day 16
secondary_outcome.description: Nasal Congestion was assessed by the participants pre-ABC exposure and approximately every 15 minutes while in the ABC on Day 0 and Day 16 on a 0-4 scale (0 = none to 4 = severe). The change in average nasal congestion score between Day 0 and Day 16 was analyzed.

arm_group.description: Two sprays in each nostril daily starting the day in office on Day 0 for up to a 17 day period until Day 16.
Two sprays in each nostril daily starting the day in office on Day 0 for up to a 17 day period until Day 16.

intervention.description: two sprays in each nostril once daily
two sprays in each nostril once daily

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from one site in the US.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Twenty-two participants enrolled and completed the study. Participant flow and baseline characteristics are presented for the 22 subjects that met all inclusion criteria, none of the exclusion criteria and were randomized to receive Fluticasone Propionate or Placebo nasal spray twice daily based on the randomization list.

group.title: Fluticasone Propionate Nasal Spray
group.description: Two sprays in each nostril daily starting the day in office on Day 0 for up to a 17 day period until Day 16.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from baseline (Day 0) through study completion (Day 16). All subjects who received study medication were evaluable for the safety analysis.
reported_events.desc: Throughout the visits, staff collected all Adverse Events reported, elicited, or observed.

group.title: Fluticasone Propionate Nasal Spray
group.description: Two sprays in each nostril daily starting the day after Day 1 for up to 14 days.

group.title: Placebo Nasal Spray
group.description: Two sprays in each nostril daily starting the day after Day 1 for up to 14 days.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
